This ground-breaking new internet layer opens up previously unimaginable possibilities for payments, commerce and markets that can help raise global economic prosperity and enhance inclusion. Our infrastructure – including USDC, a blockchain-based dollar – helps businesses, institutions and developers harness these breakthroughs and capitalize on this major turning point in the evolution of money and technology.

What you’ll be part of:

Circle is committed to visibility and stability in everything we do. As we grow as an organization, we're expanding into some of the world's strongest jurisdictions. Speed and efficiency are motivators for our success and our employees live by our company values: Multistakeholder, Mindfulness, Driven by Excellence and High Integrity. Circlers are consistently evolving in a remote world where strength in numbers fuels team success. We have built a flexible and diverse work environment where new ideas are encouraged and everyone is a stakeholder.

What you’ll be responsible for: 

Circle is looking for an experienced Head of Financial Operations who will be responsible for building and operating many of Circle’s core finance processes (e.g., procure to pay, order to cash) as we grow and scale internationally. You will also be responsible for our finance systems, and for effective project leadership and management of complex, cross-functional finance projects, including our internationalization efforts. 

What you'll work on: 

  • Designing, building, scaling, and operating core financial operations processes.
  • Develop and deliver upon a strategic systems roadmap.
  • Serving as the finance point of contact for our cross-functional international operations team.
  • Acting as project center of excellence for finance, leading and managing important cross functional projects.
  • Collaborating closely with Accounting, Tax, Treasury, FP&A teams within finance, while also working closely with cross-functional partners including Product, Engineering, Business, Risk, and Compliance.
  • Build a high-performing team to execute upon the above.

You will aspire to our four core values:

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail.  
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards.  You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle:

  • 15+ years of experience in financial operations, leading increasingly complex projects and operating processes across multiple jurisdictions.
  • 10+ years of management experience, including building effective, collaborative, and high performing teams.
  • Customer service mindset.
  • Ability to work in an ambiguous and rapidly changing environment.
  • Deep service operations experience including operating model and process design.
  • Experience collaborating cross functionally and driving results while working with a wide variety of stakeholders.
  • Experience leading complex projects, while setting objectives and ensuring accountability from project participants. 
  • Strong problem solving and communication skills.
  • Ability to travel up to 20% of the time.

  • This position is eligible for day-one PERM sponsorship for qualified candidates.

Circle's expansion into global markets and the development of new USDC-related products necessitate your cross-functional involvement in aligning internal processes and corporate structures for each market. Your role includes figuring out appropriate entry strategy for different jurisdictions, ranging from local liaisons to full licensing, based on market demand and legislation. You'll lead cross-functional teams to establish the needed infrastructure and investments, covering aspects like staffing, co-marketing, licensing, banking, invoicing, taxes, and customer support.

Your success in driving these processes hinges on your ability to partner across functions and achieve results.

  • Collaborating with Product, Legal, Compliance, and Finance teams to align and implement country-specific frameworks, structures, and investments for success.
  • Working with various departments, including People/Talent, Marketing, and Engineering, for country-specific operational needs, including hiring local leaders.
  • Operationalizing countries, either through co-marketing partnerships or licensed entities, ensuring regulatory compliance.
  • Establishing alignment frameworks, internal check-ins, and status update communications for country rollout plans.
  • Redefining strategy into actionable goals, budgets, and performance metrics, bridging global strategy with local requirements.
  • Developing a rollout playbook, setting achievements, removing roadblocks, and ensuring the right teams and leaders are in place regionally.

  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • Deep proven passion for the potential of digital currency as well as a clear interest in crypto and financial markets, the global macro-economy, and a strong commercial instinct.
  • 12+ years of working effectively as part of a cross-functional team, ideally in the fintech industry, to launch new operations, products and business lines in established and emerging markets internationally and which have potential regulatory, legal, and policy implications/requirements.
  • Relevant experience and understanding of the regulated financial services industry.
  • Prior experience planning and operationalizing entering a new country including launching on-the-ground operations and infrastructure.
  • Extensive experience living, working, and/or traveling internationally, ability to travel significantly (e.g. 3-4x a quarter, including 1-2 weeks at a time for longer haul destinations), and possesses exceptional cultural awareness that enables you to collaborate closely and form relationships with collaborators in any market.
  • Affinity for program management and using technology solutions to help scale our team’s processes, and comfort with GSuite applications, as well as other tech SaaS tools (such as SQL, Figma, Slack, Coda, etc.).
  • Excellent written communicator, able to present complex issues clearly and concisely, whether extemporaneously on Slack, in emails, or in memoranda and other more formal documents.
  • Experience/familiarity with Slack, Apple MacOS and GSuite.

Circle's expansion into global markets and the development of new USDC-related products necessitate your cross-functional involvement in aligning internal processes and corporate structures for each market. Your role includes figuring out appropriate entry strategy for different jurisdictions, ranging from local liaisons to full licensing, based on market demand and legislation. You'll lead cross-functional teams to establish the needed infrastructure and investments, covering aspects like staffing, co-marketing, licensing, banking, invoicing, taxes, and customer support.

Moreover, as Circle diversifies beyond its core USDC offering into network and technology services, your responsibility extends to ensuring the company's corporate and operational structure supports the delivery of these new products effectively. Your success in driving these processes hinges on your ability to partner across functions and achieve results.

What you'll work on: 

  • Collaborating with Product, Legal, Compliance, and Finance teams to align and implement country-specific frameworks, structures, and investments for success.
  • Working with various departments, including People/Talent, Marketing, and Engineering, for country-specific operational needs, including hiring local leaders.
  • Operationalizing countries, either through co-marketing partnerships or licensed entities, ensuring regulatory compliance.
  • Establishing alignment frameworks, internal check-ins, and status update communications for country rollout plans.
  • Redefining strategy into actionable goals, budgets, and performance metrics, bridging global strategy with local requirements.
  • Developing a rollout playbook, setting achievements, removing roadblocks, and ensuring the right teams and leaders are in place regionally.
  • Personally committed to achieving company-level objectives and key results for global expansion and product success.

  • Multistakeholder - you have dedication and commitment to our customers, shareholders, employees and families and local communities.
  • Mindful - you seek to be respectful, an active listener and to pay attention to detail. 
  • Driven by Excellence - you are driven by our mission and our passion for customer success which means you relentlessly pursue excellence, that you do not tolerate mediocrity and you work intensely to achieve your goals. 
  • High Integrity - you seek open and honest communication, and you hold yourself to very high moral and ethical standards. You reject manipulation, dishonesty and intolerance.

What you’ll bring to Circle: 

  • Deep proven passion for the potential of digital currency as well as a clear interest in crypto and financial markets, the global macro-economy, and a strong commercial instinct.
  • 12+ years of working effectively as part of a cross-functional team, ideally in the fintech industry, to launch new operations, products and business lines in established and emerging markets internationally and which have potential regulatory, legal, and policy implications/requirements.
  • Relevant experience and understanding of the regulated financial services industry.
  • Prior experience planning and operationalizing entering a new country including launching on-the-ground operations and infrastructure.
  • Extensive experience living, working, and/or traveling internationally, ability to travel significantly (e.g. 3-4x a quarter, including 1-2 weeks at a time for longer haul destinations), and possesses exceptional cultural awareness that enables you to collaborate closely and form relationships with collaborators in any market.
  • Affinity for program management and using technology solutions to help scale our team’s processes, and comfort with GSuite applications, as well as other tech SaaS tools (such as SQL, Figma, Slack, Coda, etc.).
  • Excellent written communicator, able to present complex issues clearly and concisely, whether extemporaneously on Slack, in emails, or in memoranda and other more formal documents.

Established in 1744, Sotheby’s is the world’s premier destination for art and luxury. Synonymous with innovation, Sotheby’s promotes access, connoisseurship and preservation of fine art and rare objects through auctions, private sales and retail locations. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 50 categories, which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Interiors, among many others.

 

THE ROLE

Sotheby’s is looking for an experienced product leader for all front-end experiences that drive demand on Sothebys.com and the mobile app. The role encompasses all affiliated Sotheby’s websites and business formats including auctions, private sales and marketplace businesses.

This role leads the long term product strategy, roadmap and execution for Sotheby’s during this critical stage of transformation. You will work closely with your team of product managers on scope and roadmap, partner with designers on user experience, engineering leadership on resource planning, and, most critically, partner with our business teams to execute the roadmap and drive our product transformation. ABOUT SOTHEBY'S

Established in 1744, Sotheby’s is the world’s premier destination for art and luxury. Synonymous with innovation, Sotheby’s promotes access, connoisseurship and preservation of fine art and rare objects through auctions, private sales and retail locations. Our trusted global marketplace is supported by a network of specialists spanning 40 countries and 50 categories, which include Contemporary Art, Modern and Impressionist Art, Old Masters, Chinese Works of Art, Jewelry, Watches, Wine and Spirits, and Interiors, among many others.

 

THE ROLE

Sotheby’s is looking for an experienced product leader for all front-end experiences that drive demand on Sothebys.com and the mobile app. The role encompasses all affiliated Sotheby’s websites and business formats including auctions, private sales and marketplace businesses.

This role leads the long term product strategy, roadmap and execution for Sotheby’s during this critical stage of transformation. You will work closely with your team of product managers on scope and roadmap, partner with designers on user experience, engineering leadership on resource planning, and, most critically, partner with our business teams to execute the roadmap and drive our product transformation. You will also work with other product disciplines to build unique experiences for our clients. You will leverage research, data and metrics to understand our clients’ preferences and make critical product decisions/tradeoffs. 

The ideal candidate is someone who excels at delivery, is passionate about user experience, has experience working on front-end consumer facing products, and has worked closely with design and data teams to build consumer products.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Develop a deep understanding of Sotheby’s core business lines 
  • Create a product vision for our client facing applications by conducting market research, user interviews and data analysis
  • Define a roadmap by generating/collecting product ideas and assessing impact-based priorities 
  • Work closely with engineering leadership on resource planning
  • Work closely with the design team to develop mockups and conduct user research 
  • Work with the data science team to understand key user/business metrics, testing plans and define measurement for individual projects 
  • Drive project execution to meet its timeline by leading agile scrum sessions with development teams 
  • Lead executive updates and stakeholder meetings
  • Write concise product requirements and summaries for new feature releases
  • Develop strong partnerships with both product and business teams
  • Lead working group meetings to make key decisions, remove obstacles, and raise risks ensuring business goals are met and support the strategic vision of each associated product.

IDEAL EXPERIENCE & COMPETENCIES

  • 15+ years product management experience, with at least seven years of management experience
  • Experience in a consumer technology environment 
  • Experience building websites and apps that were successfully launched in the market
  • Ability to set and drive the big picture strategy for a cross-functional team, while also providing detailed guidance on individual projects 
  • Demonstrated interest in user experience or art
  • Proficient in common product design and management frameworks
  • Organized, collaborative and flexible, able to work calmly and professionally under time sensitive deadlines
  • Logical problem solver and decision maker with strong attention to details and clear assessment of tradeoffs
  • Listens well to stakeholders and business owners while remaining focused on finding a path to delivering delightful experiences.
  • Analytical, with a data first mindset
  • Functions well in an agile environment
  • Excellent written and communication skills
  • ​​Experience working in eCommerce, Lifestyle, Luxury or Arts is a plus
  • ​​A degree in a technical or quantitative major is strongly preferred
